qas.question: What did Leni Riefenstahl do in the 1960's?
Who controlled film production in West-Germany?

context: <b4_0>German cinema<b4_0/> dates back to the very early years of the medium with the work of <a0_0>Max Skladanowsky<a0_0/>. It was particularly influential during the years of the Weimar Republic with German expressionists such as Robert Wiene and Friedrich Wilhelm Murnau. The Nazi era produced mostly <a1_0><b5_0>propaganda<a1_0/> films<b5_0/> although the work of Leni Riefenstahl still introduced new aesthetics in film. From the <a3_0>1960s<a3_0/>, New German Cinema directors such as Volker Schlöndorff, Werner Herzog, Wim Wenders, Rainer Werner Fassbinder <b6_0>placed West-German cinema back onto the international stage<b6_0/> with their often provocative films, while the <a2_0><b7_0>Deutsche Film-Aktiengesellschaft<b7_0/><a2_0/> controlled film production in the GDR.
